programme.title: SUI v CAN (Round Robin) - Men's Curling | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: This round robin game (Draw 7, Sheet D) was held at the Gangneung Curling Centre on 18 February 2018.

programme.title: SEVENSECONDS, the dream of flying | Film
programme.desc: The Monsterbakken, literally the Monster Hill, is the largest ski flying hill in the world. When you sit on the take-off bar, the adrenaline level is equivalent to a panic attack and yet it is the declared goal of our two main characters to sit on this bar and plunge into the void at the first official women's ski flying event in history.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | Luge with Nat and Cat
programme.desc: For the first time, a competition of Women's Doubles Luge is being hosted in an Olympic Games. Teenagers Caitlin Nash and Natalie Corless from the Canadian Team arrive at the Olympia Bob Run to do the track walk with their coach Matt Murray. We follow their participation during the Olympic Games: training, sleds preparation and the day of competition. Following a tricky first round in the Competition Day, the Canadian couple makes some sled adjustment and in the second and final round they secure the silver medal in what was an emotional journey through friendship, camaraderie, and the thrills and spills of this awesome sliding discipline.

programme.title: Vancouver 2010 Historical Flashback: Curling Men
programme.desc: Enjoy the action of Men's Curling from Vancouver 2010

programme.title: Germany’s Katarina Witt (extended)
programme.desc: Witt was a captivating and skilful figure skating champion. Now, the German legend is working to help those with physical disabilities

programme.title: We Are One
programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of the emotional journey of how the Unified Korean Team came to be and its legacy.

programme.title: Pairs Free Skating - Figure Skating | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: The pairs free skating was held at the Gangneung Ice Arena on 15 February 2018.

programme.title: Wrapping Up the Grand Prix Season | On Edge
programme.desc:
With the sixth and final Grand Prix completed, coach Marie-France Dubreuil reflects on what each of the teams have achieved so far. Zach is curious about Madison and Adrian’s wedding plans. Gabriella makes an intriguing prediction about the Beijing 2022 Winter Olympics podium.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: A Spanish Duel for the Holiday Season | On Edge
programme.desc:
It's down to the wire as Olivia and Adrian travel to Jaca, Spain, to compete against their rivals for the Spanish Olympic spot. Losing is not an option. Back in Montreal, Madison and Evan who decided to be safe and spend the holidays in Canada, share their hopes and expectations from the coming Olympic Games.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Full House for Beijing 2022 | On Edge
programme.desc:
In this 12th and final episode of On Edge, the teams put the final touches on their programs ahead of the Beijing 2022 Olympics. Gabby and Guillaume, back from a win at the French National Championships, are focused on beating their Russian rivals at the Games. Madison and Zach, skating for their last time at the US National Championships, go head to head against Madison and Evan. Scott Moir explains what it takes to make an Olympic podium.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: The Journey Ends with Triumph at Beijing 2022 | On Edge
programme.desc:
This special extra episode of On Edge, chronicles the Beijing 2022 experience of our six teams as their months of training and preparation culminates in success for all of them in the Olympic Ice Dance competition.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Ice Dance (Short Dance) - Figure Skating | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: The short dance was held at the Gangneung Ice Arena on 19 February 2018.

programme.title: How Malaysia’s first Olympic figure skater made history in PyeongChang
programme.desc: The emotional full story of how Julian Yee trained in a Malaysian mall in order to make history at the 2018 Olympic Winter Games.

programme.title: From The Top Episode 4: Nathan Chen and Hayley Kiyoko
programme.desc: Olympic figure skater Nathan Chen meets music star Hayley Kiyoko. She runs him through the choreography for one of her tracks, before they hit the ice-skating rink and attempt to implement the new choreography moves to surprising results. Hayley and Nathan also discuss their community responsibilities and open up about what it means for them to be Asian American role models.

programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of the emotional journey of how the Unified Korean Team came to be and its legacy.

This special extra episode of On Edge, chronicles the Beijing 2022 experience of our six teams as their months of training and preparation culminates in success for all of them in the Olympic Ice Dance competition.
Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Last Touches Before the Start of the Season | On Edge
programme.desc: The teams are prepping for one of the first major competitions of the season: Finlandia Trophy. Madison and Evan take their music changes to the rink. Lilah and Lewis reflect on how they started ice dancing together revealing that their targets are both Beijing 2022 and Cortina 2026. Madison Hubbell tries on costumes and speaks out about her relationship with Adrian. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | Speed Skating with Nil and Diego
programme.desc: The St. Moritz frozen lake was the unusual venue that hosted the Speed Skating competition. For most of the athletes that participated it was the very first time they competed on a frozen lake. In this episode, we follow the athletes Nil Llop from Spain and Diego Amaya from Colombia. Nil and Diego won the two silver medals in the 500 metres and in the Mass Start categories, against all odds. This Silver Medal was historical for both countries because it was the first medal ever won by each country in a Speed Skating Olympic Competition. On top and equally impressive is the fact that no Speed Skating rinks exist in either of their home nations and so Nil and Diego both have to live away from home, abroad, in order to follow their dream of becoming professional Speed Skaters.

programme.title: Salt Lake City 2002: US snowboarding sweep stirs passions at glorious Games
programme.desc: A rousing 2002 Games saw America’s home heroes bring skiing glory and inspire a new generation of speed skating and snowboarding addicts

programme.title: Gala exhibition - Figure Skating | Beijing 2022 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 20/02/2022 at the Capital Indoor Stadium.

programme.title: Sliding Madness | A journey on Luge, Speed Skating, Skeleton & Monobob tracks
programme.desc: St. Moritz, Switzerland, January 2020, the Winter Youth Olympic Games. Skeleton, Luge, Speed Skating and Monobob are the four disciplines that are hosted in the Alpine village. Teenage athletes from all around the globe participate for the first time in an Olympic Games, not only the competition is important to them, the friendship between Teams, the camaraderie and the Olympic Spirit embrace these young athletes during these Games leaving them all with an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: Women's Free Skating - Figure Skating | PyeongChang 2018 Replays
programme.desc: The women's free skating was held at the Gangneung Ice Arena on 23 February 2018.

programme.title: Meet this Big, Competitive Ice Dance Family | On Edge
programme.desc:
Meet the six teams training together at the Ice Academy of Montreal in Canada for the Olympic Games Beijing 2022. Gabriella and Guillaume reflect on their PyeongChang experience. Madison and Zach have some on-ice tension and speak about their emotional connection and Scott Moir tells us what it takes to be an Olympic champion. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.
Featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: A Mountain of Problems to Solve | On Edge
programme.desc: It is 5 months until Beijing 2022 and as coach Romain Haguenauer puts it: “There is a mountain of problems to solve” technically, artistically and physically for the athletes to be ready. In this second episode of the weekly series On Edge, get an intimate look at how the coaching system at the Academy operates and what it takes to prep the athletes’ programs. Madison and Evan reveal their new routine theme and work on the costume design. Olivia and Adrian perform their new program in front of the coaches and training mates for the first time. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly ice dancing reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.

programme.title: Big Last-Minute Changes | On Edge
programme.desc: Madison and Evan take the risk of changing their program’s music in the last minute. Madison and Zach are headed to Boston for their first competition of the season. Olivia and Adrian reflect on the coaches’ disappointment and work on improvements. Laurence and Nikolaj open up about Nikolaj’s injury and road to recovery. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries featuring athletes Madison Chock and Evan Bates (USA), Gabriella Papadakis and Guillaume Cizeron (FRA), Madison Hubbell and Zach Donohue (USA), Olivia Smart and Adrian Diaz (ESP), Laurence Fournier-Beaudry and Nikolaj Sorensen (CAN), Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson (GBR), and coaches Marie-France Dubreuil and Patrice Lauzon, Romain Haguenauer and three time Olympic Gold medallist Scott Moir.

programme.title: Last Touches Before the Start of the Season | On Edge
programme.desc: The teams are prepping for one of the first major competitions of the season: Finlandia Trophy. Madison and Evan take their music changes to the rink. Lilah and Lewis reflect on how they started ice dancing together revealing that their targets are both Beijing 2022 and Cortina 2026. Madison Hubbell tries on costumes and speaks out about her relationship with Adrian. Filmed in the last six months leading up to Beijing 2022, On Edge is the Olympic Channel’s first weekly figure skating reality docuseries chronicling the day-to-day lives of six teams from five countries training at the Ice Academy of Montreal.

programme.title: Women's Free Skating - Figure Skating | Beijing 2022 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 17/02/2022 at the Capital Indoor Stadium. Anna Shcherbakova (ROC) won the gold medal with 255.95 points. Her teammate Alexandra Trusova (ROC) scored a total of 251.73 and took the silver while Kaori Sakamoto (JPN) came third with 233.13. The results are provisional.
